document.docAuthor: Zhao, Ping, Jilin, Yuan & Cai, Wanzhi
document.docTitle: Maldonadocoris annulipes Zhao & Jilin & Cai 2006, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Maldonadocoris annulipes, a new genus and new species of Harpactorinae (Heteroptera: Reduviidae: Harpactorinae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Maldonadocoris annulipes, a new genus and new species of Harpactorinae (Heteroptera: Reduviidae: Harpactorinae) from China

paragraph.emphasis:
Maldonadocoris annulipes Zhao, Yuan & Cai
, sp. nov. ( Figs. 1–16 )

subSubSection.paragraph: Structure. Body medium sized, subelongate­oblong. First antennal segment longest and thickest, second segment shortest, fourth segment slightly longer than third segment; eyes large, protruding laterally, interocellar space about 2 times as long as distance between eye and ocellus on each side (0.35:0.20, ♂ /0.42:0.21, ♀ ); first rostral segment extending slightly beyond anterior margin of eyes; second rostral segment more than 1.5 times as long as first, distal segment shortest. Anterior angles obscurely tuberculous; middle portion of posterior pronotal lobe with several fine transversal wrinkles; scutellum with “Y”­shaped carina, apex round. Abdomen slightly dilated laterally, especially fifth and sixth segments, female more distinct than male ( Figs. 1 , 4 ). Abdominal tip of female abdomen as shown in Figs. 5–7 . Clasper short, clavate, bent in middle, with three long setae at apex; median pygophore process short, narrow, apex turn­up ( Figs. 8, 9 ). Phallosoma ovate in dorsal and ventral views; dorsal phallothecal sclerite sclerotized, middle of distal portion slightly ridge­like, middle of distal margin concave; struts extending to middle of phallosoma ( Fig. 15 ); endosoma with about 10 pairs of triangular slice­shaped different­sized spines ( Figs. 10, 15, 16 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Maldonadocoris annulipes
sp. nov. , ♂. Habitus. Scale bar of 1 = 1.67 mm.

FIGURES 2–7.
Maldonadocoris annulipes
sp. nov. , 2, 3, ♂; 4–7, ♀. 2, head and pronotum, antennae removed; 3, apical part of left fore leg, showing tarsus and claw structures; 4, abdomen of female, showing color pattern; 5–7, apical part of abdomen. 2–4, 6, lateral view; 5, caudal view; 7, ventral view. Scale bar of 2 = 1.00 mm; of 3, 5–7 = 0.50 mm; of 4 = 1.67 mm.

FIGURES 8–16.
Maldonadocoris annulipes
sp. nov. , ♂. 8, 9, pygophore; 10, phallus; 15, 16, phallosoma; 11–14, left clasper. 8, 16, ventral view; 9, 10, lateral view; 15, dorsal view. Scale bar of 8, 9 = 0.5 mm; of 10–16 = 0.25 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype , ♂ , China , Guizhou , Rongjiang , Pingyang ,
14. VII. 2005
, Yuan Jilin leg
.
Paratype , 3 ♂ , 6 ♀ , same data as holotype
;
2 ♀ , China , Guizhou , Libo , Maolan ,
26. V. 1985
, Liu Yugang leg.
Etymology The specific name refers to the distinct annulations on femora.

This research is partly supported by grants from the National Natural Science Foundation of China (Nos. 30370161, 30430100) and the Natural Science Foundation of Beijing (No. 6042014). We thank Prof. Carl W. Schaefer of University of Connecticut for critical reading, and helpful comments on the manuscript.
